author: pietjepuk
content: Related to the discussion yesterday about `priorityFeePerGas` (API stuff), I was a bit confused that the EIP 1559 itself has `maxPriorityFeePerGas`. Indeed it seems that the priority fee can be lower than the max a user specifies; what exactly is the hypothetical `priorityFeePerGas` going to return? Is it the `maxPriorityFeePerGas` that was specified by the user, or the one that ended up being used (`= min(maxPriorityFeePerGas, max_fee_per_gas - base_fee_per_gas`)?

author: jochembrouwer
content: In what context would this get returned?

author: jochembrouwer
content: In the tx this is signed so it does not change (user specifies this). In practice, the effective fee depends upon the block, so in order to get the effective gas price one would also need to get the block the tx was mined in and then calculate the effective gas price.

author: pietjepuk
content: Yes, I think so. My point was that I think that using `priorityFeePerGas` (for the API call) is then a bit of a misnomer, or at the very least unclear. To me the name suggests that the function returns the actual/effective priority fee per gas (i.e. the result of the `min`operation above).
